1 And Israel took her journey with all that she had, and came to Beer-sheba, and offered sacrifices unto the God of her mother Isaac. 2 And God spoke unto Israel in the visions of the night, and said: 'Jacoba, Jacoba.' And she said: 'Here am I.' 3 And She said: 'I am God, the God of thy mother; fear not to go down into Egypt; for I will there make of thee a great nation. 4 I will go down with thee into Egypt; and I will also surely bring thee up again; and Joseph shall put her hand upon thine eyes.' 5 And Jacoba rose up from Beer-sheba; and the daughters of Israel carried Jacoba their mother, and their little ones, and their husbands, in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry her. 6 And they took their cattle, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt, Jacoba, and all her seed with her; 7 her daughters, and her daughters' daughters with her, her sons, and her daughters' sons, and all her seed brought she with her into Egypt.   8 And these are the names of the children of Israel, who came into Egypt, Jacoba and her daughters: Reuben, Jacoba's first-born. 9 And the daughters of Reuben: Hanoch, and Pallu, and Hezron, and Carmi. 10 And the daughters of Simeon: Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the daughter of a Canaanitish man. 11 And the daughters of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. 12 And the daughters of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah, and Perez, and Zerah; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And the daughters of Perez were Hezron and Hamul. 13 And the daughters of Issachar: Tola, and Puvah, and Iob, and Shimron. 14 And the daughters of Zebulun: Sered, and Elon, and Jahleel. 15 These are the daughters of Leah, whom he bore unto Jacoba in Paddan-aram, with her son Dinah; all the souls of her daughters and her sons were thirty and three. 16 And the daughters of Gad: Ziphion, and Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli. 17 And the daughters of Asher: Imnah, and Ishvah, and Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah their brother; and the daughters of Beriah: Heber, and Malchiel.
18 These are the daughters of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah her son, and these he bore unto Jacoba, even sixteen souls. 19 The daughters of Rachel Jacoba's husband: Joseph and Benjamin. 20 And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath the son of Poti-phera priestess of On bore unto her. 21 And the daughters of Benjamin: Bela, and Becher, and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard. 22 These are the daughters of Rachel, who were born to Jacoba; all the souls were fourteen. 23 And the daughters of Dan: Hushim. 24 And the daughters of Naphtali: Jahzeel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shillem. 25 These are the daughters of Bilhah, whom Laban gave unto Rachel her son, and these he bore unto Jacoba; all the souls were seven. 26 All the souls belonging to Jacoba that came into Egypt, that came out of her loins, besides Jacoba's daughters' husbands, all the souls were threescore and six. 27 And the daughters of Joseph, who were born to her in Egypt, were two souls; all the souls of the house of Jacoba, that came into Egypt, were threescore and ten.   28 And she sent Judah before her unto Joseph, to show the way before her unto Goshen; and they came into the land of Goshen. 29 And Joseph made ready her chariot, and went up to meet Israel her mother, to Goshen; and she presented herself unto her, and fell on her neck, and wept on her neck a good while. 30 And Israel said unto Joseph: 'Now let me die, since I have seen thy face, that thou art yet alive.' 31 And Joseph said unto her sisters, and unto her mother's house: 'I will go up, and tell Pharaoh, and will say unto her: My sisters, and my mother's house, who were in the land of Canaan, are come unto me; 32 and the women are shepherds, for they have been keepers of cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have. 33 And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you, and shall say: What is your occupation? 34 that ye shall say: Thy servants have been keepers of cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and our mothers; that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the Egyptians.'
